musicalLanguage.description: One of the most recognizable piano pieces in popular music. The original uses a gentle, rolling left-hand pattern under a simple right-hand melody. This simplified arrangement captures the hymn-like quality with basic chord shapes and a singable melody line.
musicalLanguage.structure: Intro (2 bars) into Verse (6 bars) — C-F repeated with gentle melodic variations
keyMoments: Bars 1-2: The iconic C major opening — gentle arpeggiated chords set the contemplative mood
Bars 3-4: The C to F movement that defines the entire song's harmonic language
Bars 7-8: Am-Dm-G resolution — the emotional pivot before the chorus
teachingGoals: Gentle left-hand arpeggiation pattern in C and F
Legato right-hand melody — smooth connections between notes
Dynamic control at soft volumes (p to mp)
styleTips: Play with a dreamy, unhurried quality — never rush
Left hand should be quieter than the right-hand melody
Use the sustain pedal lightly to connect harmonies

measures.leftHand: C3:e G3:e C3:e G3:e C3:e G3:e C3:e G3:e
measures.teachingNote: The signature opening — gentle rolling C major pattern in the left hand while the right establishes the melody.

measures.leftHand: F2:e C3:e F2:e C3:e F2:e C3:e F2:e C3:e
measures.teachingNote: The melody descends over F major. Let the notes sing — this is the 'Imagine' contour.

measures.leftHand: C3:e G3:e C3:e G3:e C3:e G3:e C3:e G3:e
measures.teachingNote: Verse begins — same pattern as the intro. Repetition builds confidence.

measures.leftHand: F2:e C3:e F2:e C3:e F2:e C3:e F2:e C3:e
measures.teachingNote: Notice how the melody mirrors bar 2 exactly. Lock in this shape.

measures.leftHand: C3:e G3:e C3:e G3:e C3:e G3:e C3:e G3:e
measures.teachingNote: The melody rises slightly — a small variation keeps the listener engaged.

measures.leftHand: F2:e C3:e F2:e C3:e F2:e C3:e F2:e C3:e
measures.teachingNote: Melody resolves downward to C — a satisfying return home.

measures.leftHand: A2:e E3:e A2:e E3:e D3:e A3:e D3:e A3:e
measures.teachingNote: Am to Dm — the emotional shift. The melody climbs to A4 for the first time.

measures.leftHand: G2:e D3:e G2:e D3:e C3:e G3:e C3:h
measures.teachingNote: G to C — the classic V-I resolution. Hold the final C and let it ring.
